meanings.definition: To outwit or deceive someone by making a false display of confidence or strength.
meanings.sent1: She outbluffs her opponents by pretending to have a winning hand.
meanings.sent2: He always outbluffs his friends during poker games.
meanings.sent3: The detective outbluffs the suspect into revealing the truth.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outbluffs any doubts others may have about her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The magician outbluffs the audience with his incredible illusions.

meanings.definition: To surpass in bluffing or deceiving.
meanings.sent1: The master of deception outbluffs all his rivals effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She outbluffs everyone in the art of poker.
meanings.sent3: The comedian outbluffs the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: His charm outbluffs any suspicions people may have about his intentions.
meanings.sent5: The spy outbluffs the enemy agents with his clever disguises.

meanings.definition: To bluff or deceive someone in a game or negotiation.
meanings.sent1: He outbluffs his opponents in every chess match.
meanings.sent2: She always outbluffs her colleagues during business negotiations.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbluffs the mouse into coming out of its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: His confident tone outbluffs any doubts about his strategy.
meanings.sent5: The negotiator outbluffs the other party with his persuasive arguments.
